title: super_heroine_chronicle
body:
A [[crossover]] strategy game by Banpresto featuring characters from female-led action and comedy series and harem series in an original setting. The game notably omits the male leads from the harem franchises on the roster.

Released in 2014 for [[PlayStation 3]] and [[PlayStation Vita]].

"A ragtag group of bandits whose traces can be found all across the lands, even in deepest [sic] depths of uncharted domains.
Although their main purpose is hunting treasure, they are also known to get rough with unfortunate bystanders who happen to be nearby.
It's said that the group's founder, Reed Miller, defined the Treasure Hoarders as "an organization of mutual cooperation."

title: brainbuster
body:
A professional [[wrestling]] maneuver in which a wrestler puts the opponent in a front facelock, hooks their pants or thigh, and lifts them up as if they were executing a vertical [[suplex]]. The wrestler then falls onto their back so that the opponent lands on their head while remaining vertical. 

This move is a version of the [[DDT (wrestling)|DDT]] and innovated by Killer Karl Kox, an American wrestler. 

In Japanese puroresu, the term "brainbuster" refers to a regular vertical suplex, while the move elsewhere known as a brainbuster is referred to as a "vertical drop brainbuster".

Popular brainbuster users:

* [[Adam Cole]] (Uses a variant where he drops his opponent's head onto his knee instead of onto the ground)
* [[Austin Aries]]
* [[Eddie Guerrero]]
* [[Finn Balor]] (Uses a single underhook variant which he calls the [i]Bloody Sunday/1916[/i])
* [[Ishii Tomohiro]]
* [[Jushin Thunder Liger (wrestler)|Jushin Thunder Liger]]
* [[Sami Zayn]] (Used both the standard and the [i]Brainbustaaaaahhhhh!!!!![/i], an elevated variant onto the top turnbuckle, in his old El Generico persona)
* [[Seth Rollins]] (Used a small package driver variant in Ring of Honor which he called the [i]God's Last Gift[/i])

title: godot_(ace_attorney)
body:
A prosecuting attorney and [[Phoenix Wright]]'s primary rival in [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Trials And Tribulations]]. He is a huge coffee aficionado and sometimes speaks in bizarre metaphors before presenting an argument. Also notable for wearing a red-lensed mask because his eyesight is poor.

[spoiler]He is actually [[Diego Armando]], who was once [[Mia Fey]]'s boyfriend, but seeks revenge against [[Dahlia Hawthorne]] for poisoning him into a 5-year coma, and against Wright for not protecting Mia from her death.[/spoiler]

title: psyche-lock
body:
A gameplay and story mechanic in the [[Ace Attorney]] franchise. They appear as colored heavy locks surrounded by chains that appear in front of a character during interrogation. The minimum number of locks is one, with the maximum being five. Only the player character sees them - the person being questioned has no idea they’re there (unless they already have prior knowledge of them).

Psyche-Locks come in two colors: red and black. Red locks are the most common, appearing when a person is lying. Depending on the number of red locks, the person could be hiding a simple fib, or a massively groundbreaking secret. Red locks function as a gameplay mechanic where players present evidence that contradicts the character’s statements. Once the character admits they lied, a lock will shatter. Breaking all of the locks will remove the chains and allow players to progress in the story.

Black Psyche-Locks are strictly a story element, and are much rarer throughout the franchise. These locks appear when a character is hiding a secret that they themselves don’t know about, typically as a result of a traumatic incident or from a character’s own deranged personality. Attempting to break black locks can result in severe mental damage, and no one has ever tried to do so against the character’s volition. Of the few times that black locks have appeared, there are always five locks surrounding the character.

title: siberian_husky_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

The dog ([i]Canis lupus familliaris[/i]) needs little introduction and what there is is already covered on the (Shiba Inu) [[dog (shiba inu) (kemono friends)|Dog Friend]]'s article.

The Siberian Husky is a medium size working dog breed originating from north-eastern Siberia. It was often used as a sled dog. It's a part of the Spitz genetic family (like the Shiba Inu) but doesn't exibit the distinctive corkscrew tail of most of the family's breeds.
other_names: シベリアンハスキー(けものフレンズ)

title: dog_(mixed_breed)_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park. She was specifically created for the [i]Kemono Friends 2[/i] anime.

Once again, the dog ([i]Canis lupus familliaris[/i]) needs little introduction and all that needs to be covered is already on the (Shiba Inu) [[dog (shiba inu) (kemono friends)|Dog Friend]]'s article.

Although this Dog Friend is explicitly a mongrel, her most striking feature is her [[heterochromia]] with a right [[blue_eyes|blue eye]] and a left [[yellow_eyes|yellow eye]]. Design-wise, she is simply a recolored [[siberian_husky_(kemono_friends)|Siberian Husky]].
other_names: イエイヌ(けものフレンズ)

title: dog_(shiba_inu)_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park. She has yet to appear in any media outside of a guidebook.

The dog ([i]Canis lupus familliaris[/i]) needs little introduction. As suggested from their trinomal name, it is the domesticated form of the [[grey_wolf_(kemono_friends)|Grey Wolf]], having been so since the beginning of human civilization. Thanks to aggressive selective breeding and a very malleable genome, it has by far the widest phenotypic range of all domestic animals, ranging from the tiny Chihuahua (smaller to comparable to the Fennec fox, the smallest canid species) to the large mastiffs like the Great Dane (larger than actual grey wolves, whom also happen to be the largest canids). While it is considered a subspecies of wolf, their direct ancestors are long extinct and as a result, dogs are not closely related to extant wolves.

Dog (the Friend) is based on the [[Shiba Inu]], the archetypical pet dog in Japan. For this reason, she is often conflated with the [[Doge]] meme.

h4. See also
* [[Dog (Mixed Breed) (kemono friends)|]]
other_names: イエイヌ(けものフレンズ)

title: golgo_13
body:
A long-running manga series illustrated by Saito Takao (thought he referred to his work as [i]gekiga[/i] - a more realistic and westernized style comic book). It is the oldest manga still in publication (since 1968) and the second best-selling manga of all time, behind [[One Piece]].

The story follows the epynomous "[[Duke Tougou|Golgo 13]]", a professional hitman [[sniper]] and his journey in the underworld.

Saito Takao passed away on September 24, 2021. As per his wishes, the series will continue after his death.

body:

title: lossless-lossy
body:
The opposite of [[lossy-lossless]]: an image originally in a lossless format, such as PNG, that has been converted to a lossy format, such as JPEG.

It is Danbooru policy to delete [[third-party edit|third party]] lossless-lossy images when the original is available.

title: jitsu_wa_watashi_wa
body:
A comedy manga series by [[Masuda Eiji]] about a high school boy, [[Kuromine Asahi]], who discovers that the girl he has a crush on, [[Shiragami Youko]], is actually a vampire. Even though he's notorious for not being able to conceal anything, Youko will have to leave school if it's known her secret has been exposed, so Asahi does his best to help her keep it under wraps - despite interference by a growing cast of strange classmates and acquaintances.

Also known as "Actually, I Am". Released in English under the title "My Monster Secret ("Actually, I am...")" by Seven Seas Entertainment.

Received an anime adaptation which began in Summer 2015.

title: sieghart_(grand_chase)
body:
Ercnard Sieghart, or simply "Sieghart" is an immortal from the online game Grand Chase. He is Elesis' great grandfather. He serves as the slacker and powerhouse of the Grand Chase group.

He acquired his immortality from the Highland Gods, who rescued him after being nearly killed by a demon named Dio.

He is hailed as Kanavan's greatest hero, something his granddaughter Elesis begs to differ.

title: elesis_sieghart
body:
[[Grand Chase]] character. Leader of the Ruby Knights as well as the titular group that hunts down monsters to protect their own kingdoms from onslaught of various enemies.

The great granddaughter of [[Ercnard Sieghart]], a legendary swordsman.

[[Elesis (elsword)|]] from [[Elsword]] is heavily based on Elesis Sieghart, but [b]they are not the same character[/b] due to them having different backstories and living in different universes. Grand Chase also lists a character named Elsword as her brother but, again, this Elsword is [b]not the same character[/b] as [[Elsword]]'s [[elsword (character)|eponymous hero]].

title: codpiece
body:
[tn]Literally "bag piece" or "scrotum piece" in Old English.[/tn]

A covering flap or pouch enclosing the male genital area, attached to the crotch region of pants or some other garment. Essentially the European equivalent of a [[penis sheath]].

Most codpieces are made out of cloth or leather, though metal ones also exist, sculpted to fit a man's scrotum and penis. 

h4. Examples

* post #4020671
* post #3677316
* post #4162010 [tn]metal example with flamboyantly sculpted bulge[/tn]
* post #3889801 [tn]WARNING: Explicit futanari[/tn]

h4. Notable characters

* [[Gamzee Makara]] ([[Homestuck]])
* [[Izanagi (persona_4)|]] ([[Persona 4]])
* [[Magus (Chrono Trigger)|]] ([[Chrono Trigger]])

h4. See also

* [[Crotch plate]] [tn]generally flat and have no place to fit male genitals [/tn]

* [[Jockstrap]] [tn]modern equivalent[/tn]
* [[Penis sheath]] [tn]'tribal' equivalent[/tn]
* [[Renaissance clothes]], [[Landsknecht]]  [tn]often features a codpiece [/tn]

h4. External links

* "New Yorker: A Brief History of the Codpiece":[https://www.newyorker.com/books/page-turner/a-brief-history-of-the-codpiece-the-personal-protection-for-renaissance-equipment]

title: higashi_no_eden
body:
On November 22, 2010 ten missiles strike against uninhabited areas of Japan, claiming no victims. This apparent terrorist act is referred to as "Careless Monday" and disregarded by most people. The series begins three months later, with a young Japanese woman named [[Morimi Saki]] visiting Washington D.C. as part of her graduation trip. When she gets into trouble, a mysterious Japanese man, who introduces himself as [[Takizawa Akira]], helps her through it. The man appears to have no memory and is completely naked, carrying only a gun and a cell phone charged with 8.2 billion yen in digital money.

h4. External links

* "Anime News Network: Higashi no Eden":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/anime.php?id=10474

title: kirby_canvas_curse
body:
[[Kirby (series)|]] game.

Now this is a first! [[Kirby]] was relaxing one day when a witch named [[Drawcia]] suddenly appeared and turned all of Dream Land into a work of art, literally! Kirby tried to beat her up, but she turned him into a ball, causing him to lose his limbs. Luckily, her paintbrush was having none of this, so it decided to team up with him to take down its crazy mistress!

This game is unique in that it is controlled almost entirely with the DS' touch screen, where the player draws lines and taps on Kirby to help him navigate through levels.

h4. Characters

* [[paint_roller_(kirby)|Paint Roller]]
* [[Kracko]]
* [[King Dedede]]
* [[Drawcia]]

title: nightmare_(kirby)
body:
[quote]
[i]"It was a mistake for you to come here, Kirby. As you can see, you and your puny Star Warriors are no match for me. Challenging me is the last mistake you will ever make."[/i]

-- Nightmare - [i][[kirby:_right_back_at_ya|Combat Kirby]][/i]
[/quote]

Nightmare is a major villain hailing from the [i]Kirby[/i] series of games. He first appears in [[kirby's_adventure|Kirby's Adventure]] as the game's final boss, and he desires to spread nightmares all across Dream Land.

He also appears in the [[kirby:_right_back_at_ya|anime]] as the main antagonist, where he desires to conquer the universe by selling monsters, usually to someone like [[King Dedede]]. The monsters, along with several other creations, come from his company Nightmare Enterprises.

The villain, as his name suggests, is a living nightmare, and his one and only weakness is the Star Rod.

title: jumpy_dumpty
body:
Bouncing bombs built by [[Klee (Genshin Impact)|]].

They are fairly large, sometimes larger than Klee's head. Their upper half resembles [[Dodoco (Genshin Impact)|]], with beige fur, two button eyes and long pointy ears. Their lower half looks somewhat like a red cloth bag with a heart on the bottom.

After exploding, they drop a number of smaller, spinning proximity mines that look similar but have a red, four-leaved [[clover]] sprouting from their heads.

This tag can be used for either the large bombs or small bombs and mines.

title: hitachi_magic_wand
body:
An electric clitoral [[vibrator]]. It looks like a strange [[microphone]] with a white and/or gray head that vibrates.

The Hitachi Magic Wand was originally released in the 1970s as a therapeutic muscle massager, but was quickly picked up and utilized as a [[sex toy]]. In 2013, Hitachi ceased production of the device over concerns with the Hitachi name being associated with sex toys. However, production was later restarted, with Hitachi dropping its name from the product. The device is now distributed by Vibratex, under the name "Original Magic Wand" or "Magic Wand Original".

Its Pixiv tag is 電マ ([i]den-ma[/i]), an abbreviation for 電動マッサージ機 (electric massager). Not to be confused with [[denki anma]].

h4. See also

* [[vibrator]]
* [[sex toy]]

h4.External links

* "Official product page":http://magicwandoriginal.com/magic-wand-original
* "Wikipedia: Hitachi Magic Wand":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hitachi_Magic_Wand

title: chaps
body:
Chaps are a type of protective overpants originating as cowboy workwear. Their purpose is to protect the user's legs and trousers from damage. They are usually made out of leather or similarly durable material.

Chaps are generally made up of a belt and two individual leg coverings held up by the belt. They lack both a crotch and a seat---i.e., the leg coverings are not connected to each other.

h4. See also

title: niu_za
body: Niú zá (also known by its considerably less appealing English name, "beef entrails":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beef_entrails]) is a [[Hong Kong]] dish that is mainly influenced by Cantonese cuisine. Good quality [[beef]] is selected and [[stew]]ed with the offal for several hours. This food is eaten in several ways, such as beef offal [[hotpot|hot pot]], beef offal skewers, and beef offal chunks. The seasoning known as "thirteen herbs" is the main component of the main soup stock. None of the herbs can be omitted without causing a dramatic change in flavor. These herbs are fennel, Sichuan pepper, star anise, dried citrus peel, cinnamon, [[ginger root]], and nutmeg. Tripe (all four types of tripe from cattle are edible, but honeycomb tripe is the most highly rated), [[pancreas]], [[intestines]], spleen and [[lung]]s are the main players in the internal organs of cattle. This dish is usually served with chili oil and black pepper.

title: charger_(left_4_dead)
body:
One of the playable special infected in the [[Left 4 Dead]] series.

The Charger is zombie who has a big arm used to grab and pummel a survivor. True to it's name, it charges at the survivor at full speed grabbing one and sending others flying away from it's path. The Charger makes a distinct cow noise while charging and mutters to itself when nearby.

title: spitter_(left_4_dead)
body:
One of the playable special infected in the [[Left 4 Dead]] series.

The Spitter is zombie with a long neck capable of spitting acidic spit and leaving a pool on contact. It makes a distinct screeching sound when near one.

title: jockey_(left_4_dead)
body:
One of the playable special infected in the [[Left 4 Dead]] series.

The Jockey is a small zombie which grabs onto a survivor and rides them away from their objective. It has a distinct frantic cackling when near one.

title: witch_(left_4_dead)
body:
The only non-playable special infected that counts as a boss in the [[Left 4 Dead]] series.

The Witch is a pale zombie who has dangerously sharp nails. The Witch will only be provoked when the survivors are close to her, flashing light on her or when she gets shot.

title: smoker_(left_4_dead)
body:
One of the playable special infected in the [[Left 4 Dead] series.

The Smoker is a tall zombie who uses it's extraordinary long tongue to pull a survivor to itself, choking them when caught on an obstacle or off a ledge. True to it's name, it will leave a smokescreen when killed which blocks vision and prevents communication between survivors.

title: chained_ogre
body: A mini-boss in [[Sekiro:_Shadows_Die_Twice|Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice]].

title: boomer_(left_4_dead)
body:
One of the playable special infected in the [[Left 4 Dead]] series.

The Boomer is a large zombie whose ability is vomiting bile onto the survivors that attracts a horde towards them. True to it's name, it will explode when killing one and covering anyone in bile caught during it. It makes a distinct gurgling sound when near one.

title: tank_(left_4_dead)
body:
One of the playable special infected that counts as a boss in the [[Left 4 Dead]] series.

The Tank is an incredibly muscular zombie who boasts great strength and durability. The Tank can withstand a lot of damage from the survivors and capable of sending them flying with a punch as well as cars and other heavy items.

title: hunter_(left_4_dead)
body:
One of the playable special infected in the [[Left 4 Dead]] series.

The Hunter is an agile zombie that is capable of wall jumping and parkour. It pounces it's target and deals massive damage against them if they are not saved. The Hunter has a distinct scream while pouncing and only makes noises while it's crouching.

title: donnel_(fire_emblem)
body:
Donnel ([b]Denis[/b] in Japan, [b]Donnel Tinhead[/b] in the Western version) is a character of the Villager class in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

A young man from the countryside that joins the Shepherds after they protect his town from being razed by bandits. He has an astonishing learning ability, reflected by his Aptitude perk in-game, which allows him to increase each of his stats each time he reaches a level.

He can be obtained during the first Paralogue. If he reaches Level 4 at any point during the Paralogue, he will automatically join your party at the end.

Voiced by Ichiki Mitshuhiro in the Japanese version and Sam Riegel in the NA version.

h4. External Links 

* "Fire Emblem Wiki":http://fireemblem.wikia.com/wiki/Donnel

title: frederick_(fire_emblem)
body:
A controllable character from [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

[[Chrom (fire emblem)|Chrom]]'s lieutenant, an Ylissean knight who is sincere to a fault. He tends to demand tremendous effort for seemingly trivial things, and prefaces such exercises with a grin. The fondest of starting fires. Born on August 26th.

Voiced by [[Ono Daisuke]] in Japanese and by Kyle Hebert in English.

English Name: [b]Frederick[/b]

title: owain_(fire_emblem)
body:
Owain (ウード Eudes) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

He is voiced by Takahashi Hidenori in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Myrmidon
 
A hot-blooded youth with a passion for legendary heroes and, more importantly, their legendary weapons.
He almost constantly speaks in a theatrical manner, concocting extensive narratives about himself as a chosen hero cursed with an uncontrollable sword hand which thirsts for the blood of his enemies.
Often, he claims his roused power runs wild although actual harm is not likely.

h4.See also

* [[Odin (Fire Emblem)]]

title: duftmon
body:
A Holy Knight [[Digimon]]. Duftmon resembles a winged, thin knight with a lion inspired head piece. It can transform into Leopard Mode, in which it takes the shape of a cheetah-like feline. It is a member of the Royal Knights, and is considered their greatest strategist. 

Duftmon is referred to as [b]Leopardmon[/b] in English material.

title: craniummon
body:
A Holy Knight [[Digimon]]. Craniummon is a colossal undead knight-like being, but despite its appearance it is in fact one of Yggdrasil's most loyal servants. It wields a massive double-bladed broadsword named the Duo Solar Spear. 

It is a member of the Royal Knights, and carries the title of "Holy Knight of Loyalty" (忠誠の聖騎士, [i]Chuusei no Hijiri Kishi[/i]).

Craniummon is referred to as [b]Craniamon[/b] in English material.

title: gankoomon
body: A Holy Knight [[Digimon]]. Gankoomon resembles a man in a trench coat, with a huge spirit-like being named Hinukamuy as its fighting avatar. It is a member of the Royal Knights, and the mentor of [[Jesmon]].

title: lordknightmon
body:
A Warrior [[Digimon]]. LordKnightmon resembles a slim knight clad in pink armor, with golden sashes all over it. It leads all [[Knightmon]]. As a member of the Royal Knights, its sense of justice is extremely strong, and it will carry out its duties ruthlessly and with no compassion, which aptly fit its titles of "Indifferent Warrior" (孤高の闘士, [i]Kokou no Toushi[/i]) and "Knight of Honor" (騎士叙任の儀,  [i]Kishi Jonin no Gi[/i]). 

LordKnightmon is more commonly referred to as [b]Crusadermon[/b] in English material.

title: dynasmon
body: A Warrior [[Digimon]]. Dynasmon is a dragon-like knight clad in clear white armor and gold accents, with two purple wings sprouting from its back. It possesses the power of the wyvern. Uniquely among its peers, the Royal Knights, it will unquestionably serve its master even if said master turns out to be evil, as it believes loyalty is the ultimate form of justice. It carries the titles of "Passionate Warrior" (情熱の闘士, [i]Jounetsu no Toushi[/i]) and "Sky High Wyvern" (飛竜衝天, [i]Hiryou Shouten[/i])

title: omegamon
body:
A Warrior [[Digimon]]. Omegamon is the fusion of [[WarGreymon]] and [[MetalGarurumon]], as displayed by the "Grey Sword" carried in its left hand and the "Garuru Cannon" loaded in its right hand. It is a slender, caped knight-like creature. Omegamon is often the face of the Royal Knights in the constant absence of the group's de facto leader [[Alphamon]], and boasts the title of "Legendary Warrior" (伝説の戦士, [i]Densetsu no Senshi[/i]) as proof of its reputation as a mighty combatant. 

Omegamon is referred to as [b]Omnimon[/b] in English material.

title: shinobi_(arcade)
body:
[b][i]Shinobi[/i][/b] (忍) is a side-scrolling hack-and-slash action and shooting [[video game]] produced by [[SEGA]], originally released for [[arcade]]s on the Sega System 16 board in 1987. 

In the game the player controls an expert veteran [[ninja]] called [[Joe Musashi]], who has to stop the Zeed terrorist organization from kidnapping students of his clan. During his fight this ninja shoots infinite numbers of [[shuriken]]s and employs firearms for long range attacks, while using [[martial arts]] moves and [[katana]]s for melee combat.

Shinobi was a major commercial success in arcades; it topped monthly Japanese table arcade charts in December 1987, and became America's highest-grossing arcade conversion kit of 1988 and one of America's top five conversion kits of 1989. 

It was adapted by SEGA to its [[SEGA Master System]] [[game console]], followed by conversions to the [[NES]], [[PC Engine]], and various home computers. 

Shinobi was re-released as downloadable emulated versions of the original arcade game for the [[Wii]] and [[Xbox 360]]. The arcade game joined the [[Nintendo Switch]] in January 2020 through the Sega Ages series. 

Shinobi's success inspired various sequels and spin-offs of the [[Shinobi_(Game)|SHINOBI series]].

title: suiguutou_(juuni_kokuki)
body:
[[suiguutou_(juuni_kokuki)|Suiguutou]] ([b]水禺刀[/b] [i]Water Monkey Sword; Sword of Suiguu[/i]) is a sword that can be wielded only by the rightful ruler of Kei. The sword is accompanied by the [[hekisoujo_(juuni_kokuki)|Hekisoujo]], a miraculous gem possessing healing powers. The sword, along with its scabbard, and the gem are sacred treasures in the kingdom of Kei.

[i]The Suiguutou[/i] was forged by [b]Tatsu-Ou[/b], a previous great ruler of Kei, from a water youma and it was originally known as [b][i]Suikantou[/i][/b] ([b]水鑑刀[/b], [i]Water Mirror Sword[/i]). When Tatsu realized the sword's power could bewitch the wielder, he forged a scabbard to contain its magic. Because the scabbard was made from a [i]long-tailed monkey youma[/i], [[aozaru_(juuni_kokuki)|Aozaru]], the sword was renamed [[suiguutou_(juuni_kokuki)|Suiguutou]] to reflect its new nature. The sword and scabbard change form with each new master; the blade originally took the form of a long-handled scimitar and eventually becomes a long sword for [[Nakajima_youko|Youko Nakajima]].

title: pickle_pee_pump-a-rum_crow
body:
An unseen NPC in [[Dark Souls III]]. Only a voice and what is implied to be their nest is seen, but they can be heard when in the nest. Implied to be a crow.

While she is named and depicted as a [[harpy]] in fan-art, she canonically is unnnamed, and only has a voice in the game.  Some artists and communities call her "Snuggly", though others insist that name refers to a different crow in the first Dark Souls game.  The "pickle pee pump-a-rum" name comes from some of the limited dialogue she has in the game.

The character design that appears to be agreed to by the fan community shows her as a harpy girl with [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] in a [[bob cut]], [[blue eyes]], [[bird legs]], [[black wings|black]] [[feathered wings]], and a [[bird tail]].  She typically wears brown [[rags]] that expose her [[midriff]].

title: the_super_shinobi_ii
body:
[b][i]The Super Shinobi II[/i][/b], released outside Japan as [b][i]Shinobi III: Return of the Ninja Master[/i][/b], is a shooting and hack-and-slash [[ninja]] action [[video game]] developed and published by [[SEGA]] in 1993 exclusively for the [[Sega Mega Drive]]/Sega Genesis [[game console]]. 

It is part of the [[shinobi_(game)|SHINOBI]] series and the direct sequel to the previous [[The Super Shinobi]]. The game was originally intended to be released in 1992, and to be very different from the final version of the game in terms of levels and storyline.

Shinobi III was included on the Sega Genesis Collection for the [[PlayStation 2]] and [[PlayStation Portable]] and Sonic's Ultimate Genesis Collection for the [[Xbox 360]] and [[PlayStation 3]]. It was also released for the [[Wii]]'s Virtual Console service in 2007, for the PC on the download service Steam in 2010, on the [[iPhone]] in 2011 and for the [[Nintendo 3DS]] eShop in 2013.

h4. See also

* [[Joe Musashi]]

title: the_super_shinobi
body:
[b][i]The Super Shinobi[/i][/b], released outside Japan as [b][i]The Revenge of Shinobi[/i][/b], is a shooting and hack-and-slash [[ninja]] action [[video game]] developed and published by [[SEGA]] in 1989. 

It was the first [[shinobi_(game)|SHINOBI]] game developed exclusively for the [[Sega Mega Drive]]/Sega Genesis [[game console]], and was later released on the coin-operated version of that console, the Mega-Tech.

Alongside [[Shadow Dancer]], the game is a sequel to [[shinobi_(arcade)|Shinobi]], and features an original score by famous video game musical artist Koshiro Yuzo. 

The game was included in the compilations: Mega Games 2, Mega Drive 6 Pak, Sega Classics Arcade Collection (for the [[Sega CD]]), and Sega Smash Pack (for the PC and [[Sega Dreamcast]]). It was also re-released for the [[Wii]] Virtual Console in 2009, on the [[PlayStation 3]] via PlayStation Network and [[Xbox 360]] via Xbox Live Arcade download services in 2012, and for iOS and Android devices in 2017 via Sega Forever.

h4. See also

* [[Joe Musashi]]

title: shadow_dancer
body:
[b][i]Shadow Dancer[/i][/b] is a side-scrolling shooter and hack-and-slash action [[video game]] produced by [[SEGA]] and originally released as an [[arcade]] game in 1989. 

It is the second and the final arcade game in the [[shinobi_(game)|Shinobi series]], following the [[shinobi_(arcade)|original Shinobi]] itself. 

The player controls a [[ninja]] called [[Joe Musashi]] who is aided by an attack dog ([[shadow_(shadow_dancer)|Shadow]]), who is fighting to save the city from a terrorist organization.

Shadow Dancer was the first game developed for the Sega System 18 arcade board hardware, and its generally well-received home versions were released for the [[SEGA Master System]] home console and several home computer systems in 1991. 

A loose [[game console]] adaptation titled [b][i]Shadow Dancer: The Secret of Shinobi[/i][/b] was released exclusively for the [[SEGA Mega Drive]]/Genesis in 1990.

He first appeared in the [[Shadow Dancer]] [[arcade]] video game from 1989.

title: tales_of_the_tempest
body:
An entry in the [[tales of (series)|Tales of...]] series for the Nintendo DS, but was not directly developed by Namco. Due to the game's very poor reception, Tempest was shifted from a "mothership" title and made into the very first "escort" title, dividing the series between the main series and spinoffs/sequels. Even so, Tempest's spirit lives on thanks to the two main protagonists Caius and Rubia appearing in side material and in [[tales of the world radiant mythology|Radiant Mythology]]. Rubia also appears as a support character in [[Tales of Hearts]].

title: benny_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Benny[/b] (ブノワ, [i]Benoit[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A border guard serving the Kingdom of Nohr. The same as Charlotte. He is a great man with a scary face that both his allies and enemies fear. However, he is nice inside, somewhat cowardly, and always thinking of his comrades. He carries a homemade charm with him into battle.

Benny is extremely tall and very [[muscular male| muscular]], has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], as well as a [[scar on forehead|scar on his forehead]]. He wears [[black armor|black]] [[armor]] into battle.

He is voiced by Kiyama Shigeo in the Japanese version and by Imari Williams in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Knight

title: mahou_shoujo_taisen_contest_1
body:
The first [i][[Mahou Shoujo Taisen]][/i] illustration contest by 2.5 Dimension TV on Pixiv.

It ran from 2012-6-28 to 2012-8-8 and there were 3248 entries.

h4. Contest terms

Contestents were asked to draw original magical girls representing one of Japan's 47 prefectures. Along with the magical girl, they also needed to include a magical pet and magic wand. 

h4. Contest results

* Grand Prize (The terms said at least 1, but they awarded 3) - Prize: 50,000 yen and a 3D model of your character
** post #1647089 | [[Miyagi prefecture]] | Artist: [[kaekae]] | Character: [[Aoba Naruko]]
** post #1389355 | [[Aomori prefecture]] | Artist: [[comin]] | Character: [[Shiratori Neo]]
** post #1224902 | [[kanagawa|Kanagawa prefecture]] | Artist: [[pomodorosa]] | Character: 

* Award of Excellence (The terms said at least 47, but they awarded 60) - Prize: 50,000 yen
** post #1738736 | [[Hokkaido]] | Artist: [[eri kamijo]] | Character: [[Chiyuki (mahou shoujo taisen)|]]
** post #1204216 | [[Aomori Prefecture]] | Artist: [[samegami]] | Character: 
** post #1738743 | [[Iwate Prefecture]] | Artist: [[hironox]] | Character: [[yuki_(mahou_shoujo_taisen)_(hironox)|Yuki]]
** post #1738747 | [[Iwate Prefecture]] | Artist: [[Mukaida Kaoru]] | Character: [[Hoshi Meguru]]
** "pixiv #28712658":http://www.pixiv.net/member_illust.php?mode=medium&illust_id=28712658 | [[Miyagi Prefecture]] | Artist: [[cafe_au_lait_(kafeore) ]] | Character:
** post #1302856 | Tokyo Metropolis | Artist: [[ochau]] | Character: [[Kobari Rin]]
** post #1202947 | Tokyo Metropolis | Artist: [[mizushirazu]] | Character: [[Amakiri Rei]]

h4. See also

* [[Mahou Shoujo Taisen Contest 2]]

h4. Links

* "Call for entries":http://www.pixiv.net/member_illust.php?mode=medium&illust_id=28259542

title: kotomori_ren
body:
Supporting character in [i][[Gundam Breaker Mobile]][/i]. A [[dandere]] Gunpla prodigy from Denive Girls Junior College. The daughter of the president of Tomori Enterprises and his wife, gunpla designer Kotomori Ran. She was already competent enough to give adults a run for their money by the time she was in preschool. Her winning streak was broken for the first time when she lost against [[Kuzunoha Rindou]] in the Nationals. She becomes a friendly rival and frequent companion to the Soukai Academy Gunpla Club.

Has [[short hair]] that varies between [[silver_hair|silver]] and [[blue_hair|blue]] in different depictions, and muted [[purple eyes]] often in a [[jitome]] expression. Usually seen in a sporty version of her [[school uniform]], featuring [[suspender shorts]] instead of the more standard long skirt. Has [[small breasts]], but her [[loose shirt]] often leaves her looking [[flat_chest|flat chested]].

Gunpla:
-[[B/D Rider]]

title: kuzunoha_rindou
body:
Supporting character in [i][[Gundam Breaker Mobile]][/i]. Soukai Academy's top ace at Gunpla battle, as well as an aspiring model and singer. Daughter of a pro-builder father and pro-fighter mother, she secured a sponsor contract and went pro while still in high school. In her first year, she won the National Championship Singles. In her second year, she became captain. Her popularity was such that when she quit the club, most of the rest of its members did too. Even after graduating, she serves as a mentor to the current club members.

A tall beauty with [[purple eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] usually adorned with a [[purple hairband]]. In early chapters she still wore her [[school uniform]], but after graduating is usually seen in a [[purple skirt]] and sweater. 

Gunpla:
- [[Enzian]]

title: ulysses_(novel)
body: [i]Ulysses[/i] is a 1922 mock-heroic modernist novel by James Joyce celebrating, in detail, the events of Dubliners Leopold Bloom, his wife, Molly Bloom, and Stephen Dedalus on June 16, 1904. [i]Ulysses[/i] is a landmark of modernist literature and has been variously considered to be one of the supreme achievements of world literature. The novel's structure loosely parallels, on a mundane level, the events of Homer's [i]Odyssey[/i].

title: the_blues_brothers
body: [quote] Elwood Blues: It's 106 miles to Chicago...we've got a full tank of gas, half a pack of cigarettes, it's dark and we're wearing sunglasses. Jake Blues: Hit it. [/quote] A famous blues revivalist band that originated from a Saturday Night Live sketch by comedians Dan Aykroyd and John Belushi, who also became known as Elwood and "Joliet" Jake Blues respectively. Works on Danbooru referencing this tend to refer to the 1980 movie that also starred James Brown, Aretha Franklin, Carrie Fisher and John Candy.

title: lolita_hairband
body:
A [[hairband]] that may be cushioned or made of [[lace]]. They are often trimmed with pleated [[frills]]; if so, then it is also a [[frilled hairband]]. They may also feature [[flower]] motifs or the like. They are typically broader than other types of hairbands but do not overhang the head as a [[bonnet]] does.

[[Alice Margatroid]] of [[Touhou]] frequently wears one.

title: shooting_girl
body:
Free-to-play DMM web browser round based strategy game involving a post-apocalyptic Tokyo that has been overrun by a mysterious mechanized force called "Unknown". The player assumes the role of a newly minted "instructor" of metropolitan technical college Lily.L.A. Boot Camp. This college represents the country's last armed force against the unknown, consisting only of cute girls doing cute things with a firearm they select that reflects their personality/background/tastes. As a rising star, the instructor is tasked with raising the schoolgirls into efficient killers and taking back the 23 wards of Tokyo.

Ran from August 4th, 2015, to August 29th, 2016. Received an English release on Nutaku, which ran from June 29th, 2016, to April 28th, 2017.

h4. See also

* [[Girls' Frontline]]
* [[Senjuushi (series)|]]
* [[Arknights]]
* [[Argent Wing]]
* [[Blue Archive]]

h4. External links

* "Shooting Girl @ DMM (Japanese)":http://www.dmm.com/netgame/social/-/gadgets/=/app_id=265103/

title: alex_kidd_(character)
body:
[b]Alex Kidd[/b] (アレックスキッド [i]Arekkusu Kiddo[/i]) is a fictional [[video game]] character whose popularity peaked during the late [[1980s (style)|80s]] and who was the protagonist of both a series of video games released by [[SEGA]] and their fictional universe, as well as in numerous spin-off merchandise such as novelizations and comics. 

For a time he was the official mascot of the Sega Corporation, replacing [[Opa-Opa]] since 1987 until 1991, when Alex himself was replaced by [[Sonic the Hedgehog]].

Alex Kidd was designed by female game character designer "Kodama Rieko":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rieko_Kodama . Alex appears as a short boy (or teenager) with large ears and slightly [[monkey]]-like features, a red and yellow jumpsuit, and oversized hands.

Alex was the protagonist of several video games over the years, spanning various platforms, and appeared in the arcade and on the [[Sega Master System]] and the [[Sega Mega Drive]]/Genesis home consoles. 

More recently Alex Kidd appeared in a Japan only [[Sega Dreamcast]] game called [[Segagaga]]. He is also an unlockable character in Sega Superstars Tennis, Sonic & Sega All-Stars Racing and [[Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed]] for various consoles. 

h4. See also

* [[Alex Kidd]] (game)

title: sunset_riders
body:
[b][i]Sunset Riders[/i][/b] is a side-scrolling run and gun [[video game]] developed and released by [[Konami]] as an [[arcade]] game in 1991. 

The game is set in the American [[cowboy western|Old West]], where the player takes control of one of four bounty hunters who are seeking the rewards offered for various criminals.

Home console versions of Sunset Riders were released for the [[Sega Mega Drive]]/Genesis in 1992 and for the [[Super Nintendo]] Entertainment System in 1993, to a positive reception. 

An emulated version of the arcade original was released by Hamster Corporation for the [[PlayStation 4]] and [[Nintendo Switch]] as part of the company's Arcade Archives series in 2020.

h4. Playable Characters

* [[Billy Cool]]
* [[Cormano Wild]]
* [[Bob (Sunset Riders)|]]
* [[Steve (Sunset Riders)|]]

body:
[B]Feinne[/B] is a main character in [[Another Eden]]. She was found 16 years ago in the forest as an infant along with her brother [[aldo_(another_eden)|Aldo]] and adopted by the mayor of Baruoki. She often wakes Aldo out of bed. Her sandwiches are the best. 

Feinne has [[medium_hair|medium]]-length [[white hair]] with a [[white flower]] [[hair_flower|ornament]] and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[purple cape]] with a [[high collar]], a [[black choker]], a black [[bolo tie]], [[pauldrons]], [[detached sleeves]] or [[vambraces]], a [[white_dress|white]] [[backless_dress|backless]] [[halterneck]] dress, a [[purple_belt|purple]] [[belt]] with a [[heart-shaped buckle]] and two [[tassel|tassels]], [[white_ribbon|white]] [[leg_ribbon|leg ribbons]], and [[high heels]].

Feinne wields a [[staff]].

The student council president of her school, and one of the more friendly girls of the series, though still somewhat antagonistic to many of the male characters due to her overwhelming inferiority complex towards boys. Has a particular history of animosity with her counterpart at the boy's school, [[president_(danshi_koukousei)]], which has descended into open, public violence in the past, while getting along rather more well with his subordinate, [[vice_president_(danshi_koukousei)]].

title: ichinose_yuri
body:
Supporting character in [i][[Gundam Breaker Mobile]][/i]. A high-spirited genki girl from Nippa High. She began Gunpla battling so she could fight against her two older brothers. She wasn't able to win against them by playing normally, so she picked up a few more unconventional tricks. Her goal is to have fun playing with other people and therefore doesn't mind losing as long as she has fun. She is also a notorious autograph hound.

After competing with them in various tournaments, she befriends the Soukai Academy Gunpla Club as a friendly rival and frequent sparring partner. Often paired with [[Kotomori Ren]] as an outsider odd-couple friend duo. Her romantic interest is routinely implied to be [[Nogami Kenji]].

Typically seen in her simple [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[dress shirt]] and [[plaid_skirt|plaid]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], over which she wears a thick [[orange jacket]]. Wears her [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] [[tied_hair|tied]] in a [[high_ponytail]] like a [[topknot]]. Has markedly [[large_breasts|larger breasts]] than most of the female cast, rivalling even the adults.

Gunpla:
- [[Gundam Astray Red Frame Flame]]

title: hyness
body:
The main antagonist of [i][[Kirby: Star Allies]][/i]. He and his subordinates worship [[Void Termina]] for reasons unknown beyond an omnicidal revenge plot against an ancient civilization.

His appearance is concealed within a white [[robe]] with gold trimmings and long sleeves with a red interior. On his hood is an emblem associated with the Jambastion Mages and their subordinates. His face is hidden, with only glowing [[yellow eyes]] showing.

[spoiler]
When his hood is knocked off, his true appearance is revealed to be that of a blue imp-like creature with bulging chameleon-like eyes, ears similar to [[magolor|Magolor's]], and a big floppy nose. In this state, he shows a resemblance to [[Magolor]], [[squidward_tentacles|Squidward]] and [[Hypno]].
[/spoiler]

title: osomatsu-kun
body:
(From "wikipedia.org":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osomatsu-kun)

[i]Osomatsu-kun[/i] (おそ松くん?) is a manga series by [[Akatsuka Fujio]] which ran in Shōnen Sunday from 1962 to 1969. It has been adapted into two different anime series of the same name, the first in 1966, produced by Studio Zero, and the second in 1988, produced by Pierrot and aired across Japan on Fuji Television and the anime satellite television network, Animax.

The series follows the Matsunos, a family with a group of [[sextuplets]], going about their daily lives.

A sequel series, [i][[Osomatsu-san]][/i], began airing in October of 2015.

h4. Characters

h5. Matsuno Family 
* [[sextuplet_(osomatsu-kun)|The sextuplets]]
** [[Matsuno Osomatsu]]
** [[Matsuno Karamatsu]]
** [[Matsuno Choromatsu]]
** [[Matsuno Ichimatsu]]
** [[Matsuno Jyushimatsu]]
** [[Matsuno Todomatsu]]
* [[Matsuno Matsuzou]] (Father)
* [[Matsuno Matsuyo]] (Mother)

h5. Recurring Characters
* [[Iyami]]
* [[Chibita]]
* [[Dayoon]]
* [[Dekapan]]
* [[Hatabou]]
* [[yowai_totoko|Totoko]]

h5. Others
* [[Esper Nyanko]]
* [[flower_fairy_(osomatsu-kun)|Flower Fairy]]
* [[Hijirisawa Shonosuke]]
* [[Iyami's Daughter]]
* [[Totoko's Brother]]
* [[tougou_(osomatsu-kun)|Tougou]]
* [[kinko_(osomatsu-kun)|Kinko]]

h5. Notable poses

title: matsuno_jyushimatsu
body:
Character from [i][[Osomatsu-kun]][/i] and its spin-offs.

He is the fifth born son of the Matsuno family, characterized by his kind and energetic but rather gullible nature. In [i][[Osomatsu-san]][/i], these traits have mostly stayed the same aside from an increase in energy and a focus on athletics, particularly  [[baseball]].

Though indistinguishable from his brothers in [i][[Osomatsu-kun]][/i], he is noted by his open-mouthed [[smile]] and [[wall-eyed|crossed eyes]] in [i]Osomatsu-san[/i]. He is often associated with the color yellow.

title: world's_edge
body:
An [[in-universe location]] from [[Apex Legends]]. World's Edge is the second map, added to the game in Season 3. It is located on the planet Talos, and is near the village where [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] grew up. It is also the location where [[Revenant (apex legends)|]] killed Forge before joining the games himself.

There are Town Takeovers based on [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]]  and [[Rampart (apex legends)|]] on the map, and it was temporarily home to the [[Mirage (apex legends)|]] Voyage.

h4. See also
* "Apex Legends Wiki: World's Edge":[https://apexlegends.fandom.com/wiki/World%27s_Edge]

title: harness
body:
A harness is a set of straps that are put on a horse so it can be hitched to a wagon or a carriage. The harness distributes the effort across larger sections of the horse's body.

Harnesses have also been used in fashion. It can be intricate and fetish-inspired, and is essentially a combination of belt-like shapes meant to hug and highlight the body, usually the shoulders or chest.  Do note that harnesses don’t have to be [[leather]].

If the harness is worn around the [[pectorals]] or [[breasts]], add [[chest harness]] as well.

title: grand_theft_auto_iii
body:
The highly acclaimed and revolutionary [[Grand Theft Auto|GTA]] title which catapulted the series into mainstream success for its near freedom in unlimited gameplay and story at its time. The game serves as the foundation of the follow-ups within the series.

The game is set in Liberty City, loosely based on New York City with other aspects of American cities, and has three islands: Portland, Staunton Island and Shoreside Vale. Each loosely based on Brooklyn, Manhattan and Staten Island.
other_names: グランドセフトオート3
グランドセフトオートIII

title: grand_theft_auto:_vice_city
body:
A follow-up to [[Grand Theft Auto III]], Grand Theft Auto: Vice City was another hit for the [[Grand Theft Auto]] series.

Vice City is known for its hypnotizing and nostalgic 80's influences, music and references. It is heavily influenced by the film Scarface and the television show Miami Vice. The game's setting is based off Miami, Florida.

h4. Characters

title: erlkoenig
body:
German ballad-poem by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe depicting a father desperately riding with his sick son through a forest while being assailed by a (possibly imaginary) supernatural fae creature.

Originally written in 1782 as part of the Singpiel (folk opera play, roughly) [i]Die Fischerin[/i],  [i]Erlkönig[/i] is widely considered Goethe's most famous work. It is often a required reading in German schools, as well as in advanced German classes for people taking German as a second language. 

The ballad has also been set to music by many different famous composers, with Franz Schubert's version (composed in 1815) being most prominent. Several illustrations of [i]Erlkönig[/i] also exist; these tend to depict the father riding desperately while clutching his son, with the titular Erlkönig ("Elf King") levitating in hot pursuit. 

[i]Erlkönig[/i] is known as 魔王 ("Maou", Demon King) in Japanese. Authorship in Japanese sources is sometimes misattributed to Schubert. 

h4. External links

* "German Wikisource: Erlkönig":[https://de.wikisource.org/wiki/Erlk%C3%B6nig] [tn]Original German verses[/tn]
* "Wikisource: The Alder King":[https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/The_Alder_King] [tn]English  translation by Edgar Alfred Bowring[/tn]
* "Youtube: Franz Schubert's Erlkönig / The Elf King":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JcmP5RNB4P0] [tn]Fan splice of a singing performance set to a German comic depicting the events of Erlkönig, with English subtitles[/tn]

title: queen_of_sunlight_gwynevere
body:
NPC from [[Dark Souls I]]. 

Gwynevere is the daughter of [[gwyn lord of cinder|Lord Gwyn]], making her the Princess of Sunlight. She is located in Anor Londo, in a room above the hall where [[Dragon Slayer Ornstein|Ornstein]] and [[executioner smough|Smough]] battle the [[Chosen Undead]]. She appears in the form of a [[giantess|gigantic]], fair lady with [[red_hair|reddish]] [[brown hair]] and a kind face. A light shines brightly behind Gwynevere's figure. She is dressed in white cloth and rests on a cushion underneath her arm.

She bequeathes the Lordvessel to the player, as well as serves as the "Princess Guard" covenant leader.

Gwynevere is often associated with "Why Can't This Be Love?" by Van Halen due to "Dark Souls: A Summary":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M9x_koRZ2bA&t=139s. A lot of "Amazing Chest Ahead" and "Try Holding With Both Hands" player signs are found near her due to [[curvy|her]] [[large breasts|figure]].

h4. External links

* "Dark Souls Wiki: Gwynevere, Princess of Sunlight":http://darksouls.wikia.com/wiki/Gwynevere,_Princess_of_Sunlight

A Florida native who is currently the starting AD carry for [[Cloud9|Cloud 9]]'s [i][[League of Legends]][/i] team. Originally known as [i]SneakyCastroo[/i] (before he shortened it after looking up "Sneaky Castro" in Urban Dictionary), he is also one of the most popular [i]League[/i] streamers and also the person who birthed the "same" meme.

title: meteos_(gamer)
body:
[b]Real Name[/b] - Will Hartman

Born in Massachusetts and raised in Virginia, he is currently the substitute jungler for [[Cloud9|Cloud 9]]'s [i][[League of Legends]][/i] team. He stepped down from the starting role in the middle of the 2015 Summer Split, but remains one of the most popular [i]League[/i] streamers.

title: lemonnation
body:
[b]Real Name[/b] - Daerek Hart (born June 15, 1989)

A Minnesota native who currently coaches [[Cloud9|Cloud 9]]'s [i][[League of Legends]][/i] team, having been the starting support during his career as a player. He has the distinction of achieving first place in [i]League[/i]'s North American solo queue despite being a support primarily. He is also known as a strong drafter and popular among Asian fans because of what they call the [i][[Death Note]][/i] - a blue and white C9 notebook containing information for drafts.

title: nicolaj_jensen
body:
[b]Real Name[/b] - Nicolaj Jensen

Originally known as [i][[Incarnati0n_(gamer)|Incarnati0n]][/i], he is a Dane who is currently the starting mid-laner for [[Cloud9|Cloud 9]]'s [i][[League of Legends]][/i] team. He was formerly an analyst for SK Gaming and joined Cloud 9 in 2015 after being allowed by Riot to resume his playing career, having been previously banned indefinitely for toxicity and DDOSing. He has held first place in [i]League[/i]'s Western European solo queue.

title: hai_du_lam
body:
[b]Real Name[/b] - Hai Du Lam

A Michigan native with Chinese-Vietnamese heritage who is currently the starting support and captain of [[Cloud9|Cloud 9]]'s [i][[League of Legends]][/i] team as well as Cloud 9's Chief Gaming Officer. He started as a jungler before transitioning to mid-laner and then back to jungler and has been known as one of the best shotcallers in the world. Initially retiring after the 2015 Spring Split due to injury, he came back out of retirement and is widely credited for Cloud 9's comeback that led them to the World Championships.

title: balls_(gamer)

A Texas native with Vietnamese parents who is currently the starting top-laner for [[Cloud9|Cloud 9]]'s [i][[League of Legends]][/i] team. He is also known for being one of the fittest [i]League[/i] pro gamers despite his diminutive size.

Titled "Beast Princess of the Dark Sea", Scyllei is a perfectionist with a strong sense of self-esteem who rules the sea on behalf of her father. She has [[blue skin]] and  unspecific [[animal ears]], and her lower body is made up of two human legs, two beast legs, eight tentacles, six dog heads and a mass of tails.

title: reflecting_pool
body:
This tag describes a structure, usually framed in stone or concrete, designed to hold a shallow pool of still [[water]] for [[reflection|reflecting]] the surrounding area. They are usually found in [[park]]s or formal [[garden]]s and often features the reflection of a [[monument]] or an important [[building]].

Famous examples include the one found at and reflecting the [[Taj Mahal]], and the one at the National Mall in [[Washington D.C.]] that reflects the [[Washington Monument]].

For a simply [[reflection|reflective]] surface of water in general, see [[reflective water]].

h4.See also
* [[reflection]]
* [[reflective water]]
* [[park]]
* [[garden]]

h4.External link
* "Wikipedia - Reflecting Pool":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reflecting_pool]

title: phenomeno
body:
フェノメノ 美鶴木夜石は怖がらない

[b]Phenomeno: Mitsurugi Yoishi wa Kowagaranai[/b] is a freeware visual novel by [[Nitroplus]] adapted from the youth horror novel written by Hajime Ninomae and illustrated by [[ABe Yoshitoshi]].

Yamada Nagito, a university student living away from home, needing a cheap place to live he finds out about a mysterious "House that grants wishes" on the market for a ridiculously low rent; he snaps up the house and starts living there. Afew nights in he starts hearing strange creaking noises. Each and every night he's assaulted by these torturous noises. The last straw is when he finds the number 7 carved into the wall, as if counting down to something. Yamada having an interest in the occult seeks help from a website he frequently visits: "Ikaigabuchi", which specialises in occult topics.

(Slightly edited excerpt from "KipChu's blog":http://kipchu.wordpress.com/2012/11/10/phenomeno-visual-novel-review/)

h4. External links

* "[i]Phenomeno[/i] Official Website":http://www.nitroplus.co.jp/game/phenomeno/
* "[i]Phenomeno[/i] at VNDB":http://vndb.org/v10526

title: uh-1_iroquois
body:
Also known as the [b]Huey[/b], the [b]UH-1[/b] is a utility [[helicopter]] manufactured by Bell Helicopter Co. and first introduced in 1959 by the [[United States Air Force]]. It continues to serve in the armies of several different countries to this day.

Almost all models have a two-bladed main rotor and skid landing gear. Large sliding doors provide access into the cabin for up to 14 soldiers or 1,724 kg (3,800 lbs) of cargo. The UH-1 can be armed with a wide range of weaponry, such as [[machine gun|machine guns]], [[rocket|rockets]], or [[grenade launcher|grenade launchers]].

title: jockstrap
body:
A jockstrap is a type of [[male underwear]] designed for support and protection of male genitals, originally intended to be used in athletics or other activities requiring vigorous physical activity. It is comprised of an elastic waistband attached to a pouch (typically foam), with thigh bands to properly secure it in place.

While it has been mostly used as a utilitarian accessory, foamless or patterned variations have been made to emphasize its appeal as a fashionable and sexual garment. For this reason, both sports and fashion types are popular among gay males.

A counterpart to the jockstrap, known as a pelvic protector or a "jill", is similarly structured to cover female genitals.

title: tegami_bachi
body:
Tegami Bachi (テガミバチ, lit. Letter Bee) is a shōnen manga written and illustrated by [[Asada Hiroyuki]]. This manga is set in the fictional land called "AmberGround", where an artificial sun only illuminates the capital of the land, Akatsuki. The story follows [[Lag Seeing]], a letter bee who has a special ability to see the memories of people and items, and his personal dingo [[Niche (Tegami Bachi)|Niche]] on their journeys around the AmberGround.

h4. Characters

* [[Lag Seeing]]
* [[Niche (Tegami Bachi)|]]
* [[Gauche Suede]]
* [[Sylvette Suede]]
* [[Roda (Tegami Bachi)|]]
* [[Steak (Tegami Bachi)|]]
* [[Largo Lloyd]]
* [[Zazie Winters]]

title: atlas_(battletech)
body:
[b]AS7-D Atlas[/b]

The Atlas is probably the best-known BattleMech to ever set foot on the modern battlefield. Designed with specifications from Aleksandr Kerensky himself in 2755 in the midst of the Cameron Edicts, the Atlas was originally intended to ensure SLDF superiority over the Star League member states. Though the inexorable arming of the Great Houses continued, the Atlas proved itself to be everything General Kerensky requested. With the largest amount of armor of nearly any 'Mech, crippling firepower, and the foreboding skull-shaped "Death's Head" cockpit/head assembly, the Atlas lived up to its reputation.

(From https://www.sarna.net/wiki/Atlas_(BattleMech)

title: gordon_ramsay
body: [b]Gordon James Ramsay[/b] (born on November 8, 1966) is a world-renowned British chef. Known for having many TV shows, including Kitchen Nightmares, [[Hell's Kitchen]], Masterchef, and The F Word. Famous for [[profanity|his colourful language]] and complete lack of tolerance for incompetency (unless the target of his concern is a child, such as on his show Masterchef Junior).

title: 4others
body:
An image depicting four characters of ambiguous, indeterminate, or non-binary gender. Dolls only count if animate. Depictions of characters on paintings etc don't count unless it plays a major role in the work. If the presence of a character is only implied, it doesn't count.

To be used in combination with [[ambiguous gender]] or [[androgynous]] where applicable.
